title.narrative: 1.5 IMMUNIZATION AND OUTREACH

description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Child Health, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities

No. of states with a comprehensive budgeted plan for the implementation of the Routine immunization and Measles 2nd opportunity (State PIPs under NHM) to improve RI + MCV2 coverage rates, reduce left- out & drop-out rates (Revised indicator No. 1 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:1. The national multi year plan 2013-2017 released in May 2014 with annual milestones, M&E framework and financial analysis including funding gap for introduction of newer vaccines. The Multi Year Plan (MYP) highlights Govt., WHO and UNICEF contribution to national immunization program.2. States ha

title.narrative: No. of states which have conducted Cold Chain and Vaccine Logistics Assessments (EVM) with subsequent development of budgeted improvement plan based on at least 2 EVMs

baseline.value: 2/13 (All full programming and selected programming states )

actual.value: 2015: 4 states: Assam, Bihar and Rajasthan conducted Effective Vaccine Management (EVM) assessment in 2014 with subsequent development & implementation of improvement plan using state PIPS and GAVI HSS funds. Odhisa did a second round of EVM assessment. Odhisa and Bihar developed budgeted improvement p

title.narrative: No. of states which have introduced new vaccine(s) in their state for enhancing protection against selected vaccine preventable diseases

baseline.value: 2/14 {All full programming states, selected programming states and Karnataka }

actual.value: 2015:6 states: Among the 15 UNICEF supported states, 6 states namely Rajasthan, MP, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Karnataka and Gujarat introduced pentavalent vaccine in 2014. The remaining states that will scale up in 2015 are: Haryana, Jamu Kashmir, Uttrakhand, Goa, Puducharry, Punjab, Assam, Bihar and Chattisga

title.narrative: No. of states validated Maternal and Neonatal Tetanus as per national cMYP (Revised indicator No. 3 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:Eight states (Assam, Bihar, Chattisgarh, UP,Jharkhand, Odisha, Rajasthan, MP) validated maternal and neonatal tetanus elimination in 2014. UNICEF actively supported international validation process in all 15 States where UNICEF is programming. At National level, the cumulative total of states valid
